column4: helllllp!! i cant uninstall a program it says post-removal script returned error code 1
paste the whole output to a pastebin.
it probably wants to remove a file that isn't there.
paste the output and then i can help
this connexant package is very annoying like this. try 'sudo aptitude remove connexant'
if it wants to remove other packages though, don't say Yes.
this package has been poorly put together.
have you rebooted since installing it?
this isn't normally necessary but i notice that it wants to remove something from /proc..
have you tried removing it through synaptic?
well you can be _very careful_ and 'sudo dpkg -L connexant' and then remove all the files by hand. once done you'll need to then tell apt to forget about that package though.
but this is an extreme measure, i haven't had to do this in years.
it's best to get software through Ubuntu repositories. externally packaged software can sometimes be a bit dodgy.
you can always try to reinstall it first.. do you know where the package is?
eg install and then uninstall it. 'sudo dpkg -i /path/to/file' and then 'sudo dpkg -P connexant'
